all_summaries: The paper proposes an efficient differentially private algorithm for agnostic learning of halfspaces that adapts to large-margin subsets by introducing margin inlier/outlier analysis, achieving improved population risk bounds and demonstrating effectiveness on CIFAR-10 with pre-trained features. The algorithm uses a combination of private hyperparameter tuning and noisy gradient descent with Johnson-Lindenstrauss projection, providing both empirical and high-probability utility guarantees under Gaussian differential privacy.

This paper proposes an efficient differentially private algorithm that adapts to large margins in halfspace learning by introducing margin inlier/outlier analysis, achieving improved population risk bounds and demonstrating that pre-trained features enhance private learning performance by enabling larger margins, especially when outliers are removed. Answer: This paper proposes an efficient differentially private algorithm that adapts to large margins in halfspace learning by introducing margin inlier/outlier analysis, achieving improved population risk bounds and demonstrating that pre-trained features enhance private learning performance by enabling larger margins, especially when outliers are removed. Answer: This paper introduces an efficient differentially private algorithm for agnostic learning of halfspaces that adapts to linear separable subsets with large margins through margin inlier/outlier analysis, achieving improved population risk bounds and showing that pre-trained features improve private learning by enabling larger margins when outliers are removed. Answer: This paper presents an efficient differentially private algorithm for agnostic halfspace learning that adapts to large margins via
